field.name: URL - relation
field.definition: a web address that provides access to the resource

bestPractices.dos:
This field is optional. If there are two or more related resource URLs, add another relation tag set.
Use this field to provide access to a resource (abstract or article) on publisher or sponsor websites. Use appropriate landing pages over full text pages. Use this field to provice access to other publisher materials that can include corrections to previously published works, supplementary materials, or bibliographic records in other citation databases or on e-print servers. Ideally, URLs to publisher or sponsor landing pages should be citable, permanent and possibly resolvable by a DOI resolver.
For newsletters, like Staff Notes and NCAR Technical Notes, use the relation field to help catalog photo captions (i.e. type=Has image; title=Photo; description=Jane Doe; url is blank). For NCAR authored books, use this field for accessioning an electronic version or a publisher's landing page.
If the related resource resides in the OpenSky General Collection or other library non-archives collection, the URL structure is: http://opensky.library.ucar.edu/collections/?itemId=[DCS record number] (e.g. http://opensky.library.ucar.edu/collections/?itemId=OSGC-000-000-000-035). If the related resource resides in a library archives collection for which a URL link can be created (e.g. GATE), the URL structure is: https://nldr.library.ucar.edu/archon/?p=collections/controlcard&id=[appropriate archon number] (e.g. for GATE: https://nldr.library.ucar.edu/archon/?p=collections/controlcard&id=21).
If the related resource resides in a library archives collection for which a URL cannot be created (e.g. Mesa Lab Construction), then enter the folder name in the title field (e.g. 'Folder: Dedication: Planning Memos, 1965-1967').
When creating relationships to other OpenSky resource that are in non-archive collections, be sure to create a similar relation in the record of the other resource. [when a presentation or poster is a surragote for published paper, put poster/presenation assets in the same record as the paper. Do not use the relation field, use asset field and title.
AGU and AMS: OpenSky is allowed to post the published versions 6 months after publication. If the uploaded AMS or AGU paper is less than 6 months from publication, be sure to use the date field (under coverage) to set up a 6 month embargo period. Springer: OpenSky is allowed to post the published versions immediately but only publications that occur before the year 2014. Any publications after 2014, need to be embargoed until a new agreement is in place. When moving records with assets, be sure to move the asset. If you are unsure whether OpenSky should be holding a particular asset, contact an OpenSky administrator and do not give the record a Done status.
